examples: His ace in the hole is his political influence.
He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
She once went down that political rabbit hole.
The mayor's political future has been hanging by a thread since the fraud scandal.
we cannot lose touch with political reality.
words.defineEn: related to a country's government, politics, or public affairs
words.defineVi: liên quan đến chính phủ, chính trị hoặc các vấn đề công cộng của một quốc gia

examples: - OK, so teach me the terminology.
We just use a slightly different terminology.
So the terminology would be, major depression with atypical features.
Is that the correct terminology?
Is that the correct terminology?
words.defineEn: a set of specialized terms that are used in a specific science, art, business, or profession
words.defineVi: một tập hợp các thuật ngữ chuyên ngành được sử dụng trong một ngành khoa học, nghệ thuật, kinh doanh hoặc nghề nghiệp cụ thể

examples: Government is taking pain to lessen poverty.
The government makes a big thing out of public support.
The government has lost control of the city.
Military leaders took over the government.
The government has loosened its hold on the media considerably.
words.defineEn: the group of politicians in control of a country or state
words.defineVi: nhóm các chính trị gia kiểm soát một quốc gia hoặc tiểu bang

examples: Campaigns to save the planet/rain forest/whale.
Public education campaigns highlight potential health risks of consuming pink slime products.
The campaign for the ban was led by Greenpeace.
Have you been following the election campaign?
A campaign is under way to stop the bombers.
words.defineEn: a series of organized activities that are intended to achieve a particular goal
words.defineVi: một loạt các hoạt động có tổ chức nhằm đạt được một mục tiêu cụ thể

examples: He played politics to secure his position on the board of directors.
She always plays politics to get ahead in her career.
She just talked my ears off about politics all night.
The worm turns quickly in the world of politics.
But the lawyers also described internal politics that at times slowed down the department's work or drove a wedge among members of the team.
words.defineEn: a set of ideas and activities involved in governing a country, state, or city
words.defineVi: một tập hợp các ý tưởng và hoạt động liên quan đến việc quản lý một quốc gia, tiểu bang hoặc thành phố

examples: What do we mean by democracy?
The Council is the Achilles heel of European democracy, if not the black hole.
Although America is a democracy, a lot of key decisions are made behind closed doors by unelected advisers.
The opposition parties have cried foul at the president's act, seeing it as a violation of democracy.
Democracy is fragile.
words.defineEn: a country that is controlled by this method
words.defineVi: một quốc gia được kiểm soát bởi phương pháp này

examples: The military-written constitution reserved 25 percent of Parliament for military officers.
- During that time, these state legislators wrote, rewrote their constitution.
The constitution does not decree the right to keep and bare arms.
Anyway, as with Congress, the Constitution lays out certain qualifications for the presidency.
The framers of the Constitution wanted a limited government.
words.defineEn: the official laws and principles by which a country or state is governed
words.defineVi: các luật và nguyên tắc chính thức theo đó một quốc gia hoặc tiểu bang được quản lý

examples: The leaders of the French Revolution didn't just overthrow the monarchy.
Populist movements have rebelled against monarchies, monopolies, and a wide variety of powerful institutions.
Palace intrigue shakes one of the Middle East's most historically stable monarchies.
A junta of generals rules the country in the name of the monarchy.
The monarchy was barely clinging to control after the Revolution of 1905.
words.defineEn: a system of government or a country or state that is ruled by a king or queen
words.defineVi: một hệ thống chính phủ hoặc một quốc gia hoặc tiểu bang được cai trị bởi một vị vua hoặc nữ hoàng

examples: Election season always puts my dad's back up.
The prime minister has called an election for 8 June.
The upcoming election is a kill or cure moment for the future of the country.
The votes in the swing state may turn the tide in this election.
The election is still too close to call.
words.defineEn: the process in which people choose a person or group of people for a position, particularly a political one, by voting for them
words.defineVi: quá trình mọi người chọn một người hoặc một nhóm người cho một vị trí, đặc biệt là chính trị, bằng cách bỏ phiếu cho họ

examples: The coup gave the dictatorship a dose of its own medicine, subjecting the dictator and his entourage to torture and confinement in deplorable conditions.
They both grew up under dictatorships.
In any dictatorship, the flow of information is controlled.
There is no dictatorship in Haiti.
They wanted the end to the dictatorship of the Communist Party.
words.defineEn: a system of governing in which the ruler is a dictator that has total power
words.defineVi: một hệ thống cai trị trong đó người cai trị là một nhà độc tài có toàn quyền

examples: The votes in the swing state may turn the tide in this election.
The committee voted to kill the project.
The motion was passed by 16 votes to 11.
The bill was four votes shy of a majority.
The vote yesterday appears to mark something of a turning point in the war.
words.defineEn: an official choice made by an individual or a group of people in a meeting or election
words.defineVi: một sự lựa chọn chính thức của một cá nhân hoặc một nhóm người trong một cuộc họp hoặc cuộc bầu cử

examples: Bail is an important constitutional right.
It is constitutional cancel culture.
And what was going on inside that building was a constitutional process.
Two constitutional isomers have the same molecular formula, but the atoms are connected in different ways.
But this wasn’t terribly constitutional.
words.defineEn: relating to or operating under the official laws and principles called the constitution, by which a country or state is governed
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc hoạt động theo các luật và nguyên tắc chính thức được gọi là hiến pháp, theo đó một quốc gia hoặc tiểu bang được điều hành

examples: In 1900, the great mathematician David Hilbert listed the continuum hypothesis as the most important unsolved problem in mathematics.
Normally, light from stars is a continuum of all wavelengths.
It's a continuum.
Everything is a continuum.
From the taser to the black box, police violence exists on a continuum.
words.defineEn: a series, sequence, or whole that is continuously changing or evolving, but no part or section is noticeably different from the one next to it
words.defineVi: một chuỗi, trình tự hoặc toàn bộ liên tục thay đổi hoặc phát triển, nhưng không có phần hoặc phần nào khác biệt đáng kể so với phần bên cạnh nó

examples: The blueberries were rich in antioxidants, which helped protect the body against free radicals.
Peaches are packed with antioxidants that help protect your body against harmful free radicals.
It was revealed that the FBI kept tabs on him for years just because he once attended a meeting of a radical group.
You may have method to your madness, but these radical changes to the business could still prove catastrophic.
I really went against the stream when I was in college with some radical opinions, but as I've grown older I have found myself falling more in line with other people's way of thinking.
words.defineEn: supporting total and extreme social or political changes
words.defineVi: hỗ trợ những thay đổi toàn diện và cực đoan về xã hội hoặc chính trị

examples: The man was such a bleeding-heart knee-jerk liberal that you could predict the rest of the column after reading the first sentence.
They have liberal groups.
Even psychologists got really liberal with their applications of the test.
More specifically, pedophiles are everywhere among liberals, celebrities, and the media.
Liberals will say, "It's obvious, defense!"
words.defineEn: willing to accept, respect, and understand different behaviors, beliefs, opinions, etc.
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng chấp nhận, tôn trọng và hiểu các hành vi, niềm tin, ý kiến khác nhau, v.v.

examples: Nearly one-half of the country, from the Pacific Coast to the Great Plains and the Upper Midwest, is experiencing moderate to exceptional drought conditions.
He was too moderate.
He’s too moderate.
He was too moderate.
He's too moderate.
words.defineEn: (of a person or ideology) not extreme or radical and considered reasonable by a majority of people
words.defineVi: (của một người hoặc ý thức hệ) không cực đoan hoặc cực đoan và được đa số người dân coi là hợp lý

examples: More conservative candidates are losing ground in key battleground states.
It turned out that as a new kid on the block you are a real threat to existing parties in a rather conservative industry.
Jennifer's conservative views make her the black sheep among her more liberal-minded friends.

Mark was eager to invest all his savings into a new business opportunity, but his financial advisor cautioned him that who grasps at too much loses everything, and recommended a more conservative approach.
Conservatives have no problem with Social Security.
words.defineEn: supporting traditional values and beliefs and not willing to accept any contradictory change
words.defineVi: ủng hộ các giá trị và niềm tin truyền thống và không sẵn sàng chấp nhận bất kỳ thay đổi mâu thuẫn nào

examples: It's reactionary.
Science fiction may have its roots in reactionary motifs and worries about the myriad ways civilization might fall.
Many trainings end up being reactionary, half-day or shorter events that end up being more performative than impactful.
if you would like to see more reactionary content, do subscribe to the channel.

words.defineEn: strongly against any political or social changes or any new ideas
words.defineVi: mạnh mẽ chống lại bất kỳ thay đổi chính trị hoặc xã hội hoặc bất kỳ ý tưởng mới
